Name: Stellenbosch Wine Mag
comment: data sorted by 3 variables with date of review included from one region (Stellenbosch), code for scraper included

Name: Wine Quality
comment: two sets on vinho verde (red: 82 k, white: 258k), no reviews but data on chemical components

Name: California State Fair Competition
comment: 2,5 k reviews somewhat similiar to winesearcher concerning the variables

Name: Global Wine Database
comment: huge online database but not entirely transparent what information is included, free access includes "unlimited wines", no APIs and only 3 organizations (not specified by what that means), subscription (19$/month) includes APIs and more organizations

Name: Wine Spectator
comment: 22 k reviews from Wine Spectator: top rated (85-100) in 2016 only including vitage 2006 or older

Name: Vivivo
comment: 16,5 k reviews sorted by 8 variables including number of reviews for each wine

Name: Wine Tasting
comment: no info on actual data set but must include reviews from what I've gathered in the paper; paper might be interesting because it adresses rating processes of wines and also comparison between critics etc.

Name: Organic Wine
comment: 74 k reviews from Wine Advocate, Wine Enthusiast and Wine Spectator

Name: Wine Competition
comment: more than 4k wines in 13 different competitions

Name: Wine Spectator and Wine Advocate
comment: Wine Advocate and Wine Spectator Reviews that also include overlapping reviews for comparison

Name: Wine Prices
comment: 147 observations from Wine Advocate and Wine Spectator

Name: Oenology
comment: no info on actual data sets but panel with own specific rating system (0 or 1)

Name: GH Cellar Wine Ratings
comment: data from wine cellar from 2016 without ratings
